Description of incident: Nineteen hundred students and employees had their names and Social Security numbers posted on the Internet from spring of 2004 until the discovery in October of 2005.  A student searched her name and found it listed with her Social Security number on a UT email discussion group site.  Information pertaining to individuals who had either paid or owed small amounts of money to the University was shared among 10 employees and the information technology office.  The information was mistakenly coded as public rather than private.
